extendedInfo.description: The RSPB eGuide to British Birds is an interactive companion to The RSPB Handbook of British Birds â the ideal reference for birdwatchers of all levels of interest and experience. This application has specific features that will enhance your birding experience.NB: Please note that an additional download of 181MB is required once this app has been installed. Please ensure you use a WiFi connection to prevent additional data costs.FEATURES:Hi-res images, distribution maps and detailed text descriptions of over 290 bird species found in Britain and Ireland.Audible calls for most bird species.âBird Compareâ to allow you to compare two birds on the same screen (including calls).A personal bird list that stores your bird sightings saved to the device that can then be exported through email.View the Bird Index by Common or Scientific bird names.*Uninstalling the program will result in the loss of your list, it is recommended that you keep your own master list separate from the program.

reviews.title: Very good but....
reviews.comment: !!! Dont trust the back up for the bird log unless you have root access !!    Any mobile birding information has to be good and it saves taking notepad and pen out on a day\'s birding I\'d like to see a link between this app and the rspb site ie log in on your pc  to view your app notes maybe ?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: More like a website than an app
reviews.comment: It works, has good images and recordings, but this isn\'t an app, it\'s a downloadable website. I can log sightings, but can\'t click from sightings to bird descriptions or flag my favourites. There\'s no aid to learning, it\'s simply a catalogue, not even a \"bird of the day\". There\'s no simple alphabetical list, and why can\'t I search for birds by attribute?  That is, if I see a bird I don\'t know and want to identify it, how am I supposed to?  There\'s geographical info, but no option to filter to birds common in my current location. Why can\'t I compare birds? Side by side images and descriptions of a crow next to a raven? The text is great, but where\'s the simple at a glance list of attributes. Finally, the help file doesn\'t even vaguely match the app.  The RSPB is a world leading organisation, and they deserve a better app than this.  Seriously people, pick up your game.  And if you want anyone to generate ideas for you, just get in touch. You need to build something better before someone else does.
reviews.author: Rob Baillie

reviews.title: Excellent app.
reviews.comment: Love this app, if people took the time to explore the app properly they would find out it does most of what they say it doesn\'t. However, I would prefer the date format to be the UK one.
reviews.author: ROBIN HAINES

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: Good indexes, great pictures, good descriptions. Also has map and songs/calls.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent guide
reviews.comment: I\'ve not had it long but it appears to be authoritative and comprehensive. Very easy to use, clear, and lots of information. List functions are limited: doesn\'t indicate whether a bird is on your list. One drawback of this is the 30 minute data upload required on the first run!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not Good
reviews.comment: This app crashes every time I try to access the menu at the top.  Up date... this bug is now fixed. Now 4 stars.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Very impressed with the speed with which the jellybean problem was fixed, and the very helpful response of the developers. This is the best bird app that I have come across, although as others have said there is still scope food improvement, such as resizing the text. I\'d recommend it though.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great but flawed!
reviews.comment: I absolutely love the app...I love the RSPB...but I hate the fact it crashes frequently! Would be helpful to see in the taxonomy index whether or not I\'ve seen a bird before. Also had probs with bird sounds refusing to go off and having to restart my phone. Please fix it guys
reviews.author: Xavier Taylor

reviews.title: a good electronic version of a bird book...
reviews.comment: ... but not really interactive.  Works well on my nexus 7 and nexus 4.  Clear pictures with sexes and seasons where required, and good descriptive text. A good alternative to carrying the physical book. This has excellent sketches, but don\'t expect photos.    Suggests other similar birds, and BUT DOES NOT LINK TO THEM. You have to return to the index and type the name in! How is that interactive?  Why can\'t I search for another bird from the page of the one that has suggested that similar bird?  Compare is only the pictures, and they are NOT to scale.  My example problem comparison is winter knot and dunlin.  Unlike a book, I cannot hold open two pages and flick between them. I have to go back to the index and search again. And it does not remember what I have searched for before.   The sightings log is tortuous. I have tried to use it. For each sighting I have to search for a bird, open its page, choose to Log, pick a location (It doesn\'t remember even if I have just logged a different bird. It has to use a pop up and then a press on the save icon, and so I cannot type and press enter), and the cursor is in the comments box so I cannot just type a few letters. Then I must pick a d
reviews.author: Jim Barton

reviews.title: Good content; disappointingly amateurish UI
reviews.comment: Galaxy Nexus 4.1.1 This app is not very professionally-assembled for the price; it often falls over on resume (\'Error\', \'Unable to start application: null\') and the UI feels generally quite rough. It does not make great use of screen real estate. The content is good, though - each bird is described in detail, with a number of good illustrations and recordings.
reviews.author: Tom Lant

reviews.title: Runs on Jelly bean fine
reviews.comment: After an email to the support team about a week ago they have the crash issue fixed on Jellybean devices. Very quick turnaround. When update downloaded the database was still not visible so uninstalled the reinstalled and all working fine. Layout is okay on tablet text area is a bit small and not expandable like it is only the smaller phone screen. Higher resolution images would also help as can see some artifacts in nearly all images on the nexus 7.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very basic
reviews.comment: I take it you got a trainee to develop this application.  If I wasn\'t a fan of the RSPB then I would be asking for a refund. You would be better off going to the website. All this thing does is pull a txt box from the website anyway. And it doesn\'t a rubbish job of that.
reviews.author: Tony Wood

reviews.title: Great app but....
reviews.comment: Why, oh why, are dates displayed as mm/dd when the RSPB is UK where the format should be DD/MM - most confusing when viewing logged entries!
reviews.author: Peter Banks

reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.comment: Not had it long but it has been great when I\'m out. Don\'t have to remember my books now.  Yes could do with some improvements but will take a lot to beat it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very useful
reviews.comment: I really like it. The images are good and the text i VERY informative. Worth the money.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs Improvements
reviews.comment: Asus Transformer tf300t I was very glad to see this app available but short lived because of improvements that are needed badly. Drop down menu shown in help section not available in full, only have access to \"Log\" and \"Home\" and not \"Maps\" or \"info\". Distribution map takes up to much of the text panel and cannot be removed or minimised so reading text is awkward. Some maps not shown on some pages at all. When this app is working properly I would happily give 5 stars but there\'s a way to go yet.
reviews.author: A Google User
